info.description:
# flowable / flowəb(ə)l /

- a compact and highly efficient workflow and Business Process Management (BPM) platform for developers, system admins and business users.
- a lightning fast, tried and tested BPMN 2 process engine written in Java. It is Apache 2.0 licensed open source, with a committed community.
- can run embedded in a Java application, or as a service on a server, a cluster, and in the cloud. It integrates perfectly with Spring. With a rich Java and REST API, it is the ideal engine for orchestrating human or system activities.
info.title: Flowable REST API

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: An id of the activity instance.

parameters.name: activityInstanceId
parameters.description: An id of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: activityName
parameters.description: The name of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: activityType
parameters.description: The element type of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: The execution id of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: finished
parameters.description: Indication if the historic activity instance is finished.

parameters.name: taskAssignee
parameters.description: The assignee of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: The process instance id of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: The process definition id of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Only return instances with the given tenantId.

parameters.name: tenantIdLike
parameters.description: Only return instances with a tenantId like the given value.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: If true, only returns instances without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.

200.description: Indicates that historic activity instances could be queried.

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the historic detail.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: The process instance id of the historic detail.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: The execution id of the historic detail.

parameters.name: activityInstanceId
parameters.description: The activity instance id of the historic detail.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The task id of the historic detail.

parameters.name: selectOnlyFormProperties
parameters.description: Indication to only return form properties in the result.

parameters.name: selectOnlyVariableUpdates
parameters.description: Indication to only return variable updates in the result.

200.description: Indicates that historic detail could be queried.

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

get.summary: Get the binary data for a historic detail variable
get.description: The response body contains the binary value of the variable. When the variable is of type binary, the content-type of the response is set to application/octet-stream, regardless of the content of the variable or the request accept-type header. In case of serializable, application/x-java-serialized-object is used as content-type.

200.description: Indicates the historic detail instance was found and the requested variable data is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested historic detail instance was not found or the historic detail instance doesn’t have a variable with the given name or the variable doesn’t have a binary stream available. Status message provides additional information.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: An id of the historic process instance.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: The process definition key of the historic process instance.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: The process definition id of the historic process instance.

parameters.name: businessKey
parameters.description: The business key of the historic process instance.

parameters.name: involvedUser
parameters.description: An involved user of the historic process instance.

parameters.name: finished
parameters.description: Indication if the historic process instance is finished.

parameters.name: superProcessInstanceId
parameters.description: An optional parent process id of the historic process instance.

parameters.name: excludeSubprocesses
parameters.description: Return only historic process instances which aren’t sub processes.

parameters.name: finishedAfter
parameters.description: Return only historic process instances that were finished after this date.

parameters.name: finishedBefore
parameters.description: Return only historic process instances that were finished before this date.

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description: Return only historic process instances that were started after this date.

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description: Return only historic process instances that were started before this date.

parameters.name: startedBy
parameters.description: Return only historic process instances that were started by this user.

parameters.name: includeProcessVariables
parameters.description: An indication if the historic process instance variables should be returned as well.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Only return instances with the given tenantId.

parameters.name: tenantIdLike
parameters.description: Only return instances with a tenantId like the given value.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: If true, only returns instances without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.

200.description: Indicates that historic process instances could be queried.

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

200.description: Indicates that the historic process instances could be found.

404.description: Indicates that the historic process instances could not be found.

204.description: Indicates that the historic process instance was deleted.

404.description: Indicates that the historic process instance could not be found.

get.summary: Get all comments on a historic process instance

200.description: Indicates the process instance was found and the comments are returned.

404.description: Indicates that the historic process instance could not be found.

post.summary: Create a new comment on a historic process instance
post.description: Parameter saveProcessInstanceId is optional, if true save process instance id of task with comment.

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates the comment was created and the result is returned.

400.description: Indicates the comment is missing from the request.

404.description: Indicates that the historic process instance could not be found.

get.summary: Get a comment on a historic process instance

200.description: Indicates the historic process instance and comment were found and the comment is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested historic process instance was not found or the historic process instance doesn’t have a comment with the given ID.

delete.summary: Delete a comment on a historic process instance

204.description: Indicates the historic process instance and comment were found and the comment is deleted. Response body is left empty intentionally.

404.description: Indicates the requested historic process instance was not found or the historic process instance doesn’t have a comment with the given ID.

get.summary: Get the identity links of a historic process instance

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the identity links are returned

404.description: Indicates the process instance could not be found..

get.summary: Get the binary data for a historic process instance variable
get.description: The response body contains the binary value of the variable. When the variable is of type binary, the content-type of the response is set to application/octet-stream, regardless of the content of the variable or the request accept-type header. In case of serializable, application/x-java-serialized-object is used as content-type.

200.description: Indicates the process instance was found and the requested variable data is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested process instance was not found or the process instance doesn’t have a variable with the given name or the variable doesn’t have a binary stream available. Status message provides additional information.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: An id of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: The process instance id of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: The process definition key of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyLike
parameters.description: The process definition key of the historic task instance, which matches the given value.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: The process definition id of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: processDefinitionName
parameters.description: The process definition name of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: processDefinitionNameLike
parameters.description: The process definition name of the historic task instance, which matches the given value.

parameters.name: processBusinessKey
parameters.description: The process instance business key of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: processBusinessKeyLike
parameters.description: The process instance business key of the historic task instance that matches the given value.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: The execution id of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKey
parameters.description: The task definition key for tasks part of a process

parameters.name: taskName
parameters.description: The task name of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskNameLike
parameters.description: The task name with like operator for the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskDescription
parameters.description: The task description of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskDescriptionLike
parameters.description: The task description with like operator for the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskCategory
parameters.description: Select tasks with the given category. Note that this is the task category, not the category of the process definition (namespace within the BPMN Xml).

parameters.name: taskDeleteReason
parameters.description: The task delete reason of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskDeleteReasonLike
parameters.description: The task delete reason with like operator for the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskAssignee
parameters.description: The assignee of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskAssigneeLike
parameters.description: The assignee with like operator for the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskOwner
parameters.description: The owner of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskOwnerLike
parameters.description: The owner with like operator for the historic task instance.

parameters.name: taskInvolvedUser
parameters.description: An involved user of the historic task instance

parameters.name: taskPriority
parameters.description: The priority of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: finished
parameters.description: Indication if the historic task instance is finished.

parameters.name: processFinished
parameters.description: Indication if the process instance of the historic task instance is finished.

parameters.name: parentTaskId
parameters.description: An optional parent task id of the historic task instance.

parameters.name: dueDate
parameters.description: Return only historic task instances that have a due date equal this date.

parameters.name: dueDateAfter
parameters.description: Return only historic task instances that have a due date after this date.

parameters.name: dueDateBefore
parameters.description: Return only historic task instances that have a due date before this date.

parameters.name: withoutDueDate
parameters.description: Return only historic task instances that have no due-date. When false is provided as value, this parameter is ignored.

parameters.name: taskCompletedOn
parameters.description: Return only historic task instances that have been completed on this date.

parameters.name: taskCompletedAfter
parameters.description: Return only historic task instances that have been completed after this date.

parameters.name: taskCompletedBefore
parameters.description: Return only historic task instances that have been completed before this date.

parameters.name: taskCreatedOn
parameters.description: Return only historic task instances that were created on this date.

parameters.name: taskCreatedBefore
parameters.description: Return only historic task instances that were created before this date.

parameters.name: taskCreatedAfter
parameters.description: Return only historic task instances that were created after this date.

parameters.name: includeTaskLocalVariables
parameters.description: An indication if the historic task instance local variables should be returned as well.

parameters.name: includeProcessVariables
parameters.description: An indication if the historic task instance global variables should be returned as well.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Only return historic task instances with the given tenantId.

parameters.name: tenantIdLike
parameters.description: Only return historic task instances with a tenantId like the given value.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: If true, only returns historic task instances without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.

200.description: Indicates that historic task instances could be queried.

404.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

get.summary: Get a single historic task instance

200.description: Indicates that the historic task instances could be found.

404.description: Indicates that the historic task instances could not be found.

204.description: Indicates that the historic task instance was deleted.

404.description: Indicates that the historic task instance could not be found.

get.summary: Get the identity links of a historic task instance

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the identity links are returned

404.description: Indicates the task instance could not be found.

get.summary: Get the binary data for a historic task instance variable
get.description: The response body contains the binary value of the variable. When the variable is of type binary, the content-type of the response is set to application/octet-stream, regardless of the content of the variable or the request accept-type header. In case of serializable, application/x-java-serialized-object is used as content-type.

200.description: Indicates the task instance was found and the requested variable data is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task instance was not found or the process instance doesn’t have a variable with the given name or the variable doesn’t have a binary stream available. Status message provides additional information.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: The process instance id of the historic variable instance.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The task id of the historic variable instance.

parameters.name: excludeTaskVariables
parameters.description: Indication to exclude the task variables from the result.

parameters.name: variableName
parameters.description: The variable name of the historic variable instance.

parameters.name: variableNameLike
parameters.description: The variable name using the like operator for the historic variable instance.

200.description: Indicates that historic variable instances could be queried.

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

get.summary: Get the binary data for a historic task instance variable
get.description: The response body contains the binary value of the variable. When the variable is of type binary, the content-type of the response is set to application/octet-stream, regardless of the content of the variable or the request accept-type header. In case of serializable, application/x-java-serialized-object is used as content-type.

200.description: Indicates the variable instance was found and the requested variable data is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested variable instance was not found or the variable instance doesn’t have a variable with the given name or the variable doesn’t have a binary stream available. Status message provides additional information.

post.description: All supported JSON parameter fields allowed are exactly the same as the parameters found for getting a collection of historic task instances, but passed in as JSON-body arguments rather than URL-parameters to allow for more advanced querying and preventing errors with request-uri’s that are too long.

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the activities are returned

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information

post.description: All supported JSON parameter fields allowed are exactly the same as the parameters found for getting a collection of historic process instances, but passed in as JSON-body arguments rather than URL-parameters to allow for more advanced querying and preventing errors with request-uri’s that are too long.

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the historic details are returned

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

post.description: All supported JSON parameter fields allowed are exactly the same as the parameters found for getting a collection of historic process instances, but passed in as JSON-body arguments rather than URL-parameters to allow for more advanced querying and preventing errors with request-uri’s that are too long. On top of that, the query allows for filtering based on process variables. The variables property is a JSON-array containing objects with the format as described here.

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the process instances are returned

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

post.description: All supported JSON parameter fields allowed are exactly the same as the parameters found for getting a collection of historic task instances, but passed in as JSON-body arguments rather than URL-parameters to allow for more advanced querying and preventing errors with request-uri’s that are too long. On top of that, the query allows for filtering based on process variables. The taskVariables and processVariables properties are JSON-arrays containing objects with the format as described here.

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the tasks are returned

404.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

post.description: All supported JSON parameter fields allowed are exactly the same as the parameters found for getting a collection of historic process instances, but passed in as JSON-body arguments rather than URL-parameters to allow for more advanced querying and preventing errors with request-uri’s that are too long. On top of that, the query allows for filtering based on process variables. The variables property is a JSON-array containing objects with the format as described here.

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the tasks are returned

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.
